definition: to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: The board of directors has been fudging on the question of pay increases for the workers.
sentences.chinese: 董事会对于给工人增加工资这个问题一直推托。

sentences.english: Stephen sweetened him up and put him off a week.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂芬把他敷衍了一番，往后推托了一个星期。

sentences.english: The other made excuse for unavoidable delay.
sentences.chinese: 对方推托说这次耽搁是无法避免的。

sentences.english: The police report was filled with weasel words.
sentences.chinese: 警察的报告书里充满推托之辞。

sentences.english: After the autopsy the doctors blamed each other for the death
sentences.chinese: 他的遗体经过解剖后，两名医生还在互相推托着责任。

definition: to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
to use all sorts of excuses
to plead/to claim as an excuse
to tactfully decline/to turn down gracefully
